org.hps.readout.ecal

Class FADCPrimaryTriggerDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ecal.TriggerableDriver
        • org.hps.readout.ecal.TriggerDriver
          • org.hps.readout.ecal.FADCPrimaryTriggerDriver

  • public class FADCPrimaryTriggerDriver
extends TriggerDriver
    Class FADCPrimaryTriggerDriver reads reconstructed clusters and makes trigger decisions on them. It is designed to trigger off 2.2 GeV beam A' events. Cuts can either be set manually in a steering file or automatically by specifying a background level. The code for generating trigger pairs and handling the coincidence window comes from FADCTriggerDriver.
    See Also:
    FADCTriggerDriver

      • setBackgroundLevel

        public void setBackgroundLevel(int backgroundLevel)
        Sets the trigger cuts automatically to a given background level.
        Parameters:
        backgroundLevel - - The level to which the background should be set. Actual background rates equal about (5 * backgroundLevel) kHz.

      • setPairCoincidence

        public void setPairCoincidence(int pairCoincidence)
        Sets the time range over which cluster pairs will be formed. Value uses units of clock-cycles. Note that the number of clock-cycles used is calculated as (2 * pairCoincidence) + 1.
        Parameters:
        pairCoincidence - - The parameter value.

      • triggerDecision

        protected boolean triggerDecision(EventHeader event)
        Determines if the event produces a trigger.
        Specified by:
        triggerDecision in class TriggerDriver
        Returns:
        Returns true if the event produces a trigger and false if it does not.

      • setBackgroundCuts

        private void setBackgroundCuts(int backgroundLevel)
        Sets the cuts to accept a certain background level. Levels are defined with an integer between 1 and 10, where each step is indicative of a hypothetical background rate of approximately 5 kHz. Thusly, backgroundLevel = 1 represents a hypothetical background rate of approximately 5 kHz, backgroundLevel = 2 represents 10 kHz, and so on. Using a value of 0 will set the cuts to the original test run values.
        Parameters:
        backgroundLevel - - The hypothetical background rate value. This must be between 1 and 10, or zero for the original test run cut values.

      • testTrigger

        private boolean testTrigger()
        Tests all of the current cluster pairs for triggers.
        Returns:
        Returns true if one of the cluster pairs passes all of the cluster cuts and false otherwise.

      • updateClusterQueues

        private void updateClusterQueues(List<Cluster> clusterList)
        Adds clusters from a new event into the top and bottom cluster queues so that they may be formed into pairs.
        Parameters:
        clusterList - - The clusters to add to the queues.

      • setCuts

        public void setCuts(String cuts)
        Sets all cut values for the trigger using a string argument with the format "clusterMin clusterMax hitMin sumMin sumMax diffMax slopeMin slopeF coplanarMax timeDiffMax".
        Parameters:
        cuts - - The cut string.
